---
description: Displays content in tabs.
labels: ['ui', 'docs']
---
import { DynamicLengthContentTabs } from './content-tabs.composition'
import { ContentTabs } from './content-tabs';

This component allows you to navigate through content using tabs.

### Basic usage

```js live
() => {
  const FirstContent = () => <div>First content!</div>;
  const SecondContent = () => <div>Second content!</div>;

  const content = [
    { title: 'First', body: <FirstContent /> },
    { title: 'Second', body: <SecondContent /> },
  ];

  return <ContentTabs tabsContent={content}></ContentTabs>;
};
```

### Custom tab titles

```js live
() => {
const FirstContent = () => <div>First content!</div>;
const SecondContent = () => <div>Second content!</div>;
const FirstTitle = () => <h4>First</h4>;
const SecondTitle = () => <h4>Second</h4>;

const content = [
  { title: <FirstTitle />, body: <FirstContent /> },
  { title: <SecondTitle />, body: <SecondContent /> },
];


  return <ContentTabs tabsContent={content}></ContentTabs>;
};
```

### URL params

Use URL params to navigate to a specific tab in the page. 

For example, the following sets `my_tabs` as the param for this group of tabs. Add `?my_tabs=1` to this page URL, to load the tabs with the second tab as the default.

```js live
() => {
  const FirstContent = () => <div>First content!</div>;
  const SecondContent = () => <div>Second content!</div>;

  const content = [
    { title: 'First', body: <FirstContent /> },
    { title: 'Second', body: <SecondContent /> },
  ];

  return <ContentTabs tabsUrlParam="my_tabs" tabsContent={content}></ContentTabs>;
};
```

:::info Using params in iframes only works for the same host
:::

:::info Multiple params can be used to support multiple tab groups in the same page.
:::

<DynamicLengthContentTabs/>
